True/False Questions.question: Do you believe in the timeless narratives of romance, including soulmates and destiny?
Do you see love as something magical that is meant to be and endure against all odds?
Do you value intense, sometimes overwhelming, connections in a relationship?
Do you prioritize physical intimacy and emotional depth in a relationship?
Do you approach relationships like partnerships where compatibility in lifestyle, values, and long-term goals is crucial?
Do you see love not just as a feeling but as a choice and commitment to work together harmoniously?
Do you believe that love is shown through actions more than words?
Do you prioritize creating a stable, secure environment where relationships can grow without drama or unpredictability?
Do you hold an elevated view of love that may set you up for disappointment?
Do you always look for the good in people and situations?
Do you protect yourself by doubting the longevity or sincerity of romantic gestures?
Do you view relationships through a lens of skepticism?
Do you see your ideal relationship as one grounded in deep friendship?
Do you desire a partner who is also a co-adventurer?
Do you have a protective shell that takes time and patience to penetrate?
Are you looking for a partner who shares a particular life vision or ethos?
Do you begin with a romantic or idealistic outlook but become more cynical due to negative experiences?
Do you use words to affirm other people?
Do you prefer to be shown love through helpful actions?
Do you see gifts as physical symbols of love and affection?
Do you thrive on full, undivided attention and shared activities?
Do you feel loved through physical touch?
Do you feel most loved through the sharing of ideas and deep conversations?
Do shared religious or spiritual practices express and receive love for you?
Do you prefer simple encouraging words over deep, meaningful conversations?
Do you love everyday help like cooking and cleaning over grand gestures like planning a surprise trip?
Do you prefer personalized tokens of affection over grand, lavish presents?
Do you prefer doing activities together over sitting down to talk over coffee?
Do you prefer casual, non-sexual touch like hand-holding or cuddling on the couch over intimacy and sexual expression?
Do you consider a date night to be the most romantic activity?
Do you find gifts to be the most romantic gesture?
Do you prefer a romantic getaway over other romantic options?
Do you find certain types of music to be the most romantic?
Do you consider romantic movies to be the most romantic form of entertainment?
Do you appreciate romantic gestures the most in a relationship?
